title: Cute Instagram Symbols to Copy & Paste for Every Aesthetic

steps.title: Use heart symbols to show you like something or channel an aesthetic.
steps.content: Use heart symbols to show you like something or channel an aesthetic. Heart symbols and emojis can represent love and romance, but also simply that you like something. Even the â€œlikeâ€ button on Instagram posts and comments is heart-shaped. Aesthetics like coquettecore and lovecore heavily feature heartsâ€”use these symbols in your bio to make your Instagram profile match those trends. steps.title: Convey emotions using emoticons and kaomoji symbols.
steps.content: Convey emotions using emoticons and kaomoji symbols. Kaomojis are the Japanese version of emoticons, first popularized in the 1990s, which use various keyboard symbols and Japanese characters to create expressive faces. steps.title: Use animal symbols to show that you love wildlife or your pets.
steps.content: Use animal symbols to show that you love wildlife or your pets. Most Unicode animal symbols come from Egyptian hieroglyphs, so they look like the art found in ancient pyramids and on stone tablets. steps.content: Match the aesthetic of the season youâ€™re in with flower and weather symbols. Flowers are commonly associated with springtime, as well as aesthetics like the soft girl trend. steps.content: Show youâ€™re the king or queen (and love playing games) using these symbols. steps.title: Share your star sign or simply your vibe with these miscellaneous symbols.
steps.content: Share your star sign or simply your vibe with these miscellaneous symbols. While many people have the emoji for their astrological sign in their Instagram bio, using a symbol will make your profile stand out. Other symbols like angel wings, peace signs, and music notes are simply cute and aesthetically pleasing. steps.title: Use alt codes to create special symbols.
steps.content: Use alt codes to create special symbols. On a computer with a â€œNum Lockâ€ key, you can use your keyboard to create special symbols. [4] X Research source On devices like a MacBook, you can press â€œFnâ€ and â€œEâ€ at the same time to open the emoji selector, and click the small symbol in the upper right corner to expand the viewer and see symbol options. [5] X Research source Keep in mind that these symbols may not be supported on every device or platformâ€”or could show up differently across devices.

steps.title: Copy and paste special symbols to Instagram.
steps.content: Copy and paste special symbols to Instagram. You can copy the symbols above and then paste them to Instagram. On a mobile device, copy by tapping and holding a symbol until the copy option appears. [6] X Research source On a computer, highlight the symbol and press â€œcommand + Câ€ to copy and â€œcommand + Vâ€ to paste. You can also find aesthetic emoji combinations and inspiration if you prefer emojis to symbols (or want to combine the two)!
